textfields.tf:
Using some reference dimensions the current load conditions affect the results due to tyre deflection. Thererfore these reference dimensions should be avoided.
Please mark all reference dimensions where the load conditions have no effect.
Top edge of the vehicle frame
Bottom edge of the vehicle frame
When using the reference dimension A, which is the distance between the bottom edge of the vehicle frame and the middle of the axle beam, the tyre deflection affects not the measured value.
When using the reference dimension B, which is the distance between the bottom edge of the vehicle frame and the top of the axle beam, the tyre deflection affects not the measured value.
When using the reference dimension C, which is the distance between the top edge of the vehicle frame and the middle of the axle beam, the tyre deflection affects not the measured value.
When using the reference dimension D, which is the distance between the top edge of the vehicle frame and the top of the axle beam, the tyre deflection affects not the measured value.

When using the reference dimension E, the current load affects the measured value, because the distance between the top edge of the vehicle frame and the road surface is influenced by the tyre deflection.

When using the reference dimension F, the current load affects the measured value, because the distance between the bottom edge of the vehicle frame and the road surface is influenced by the tyre deflection.
Right, you recognized the related reference dimensions correctly.
